events.name: North Korea Launches Short-Range Ballistic Missiles
events.wd_label: North Korea Launches Short-Range Ballistic Missiles
events.wd_description: North Korea fired four short-range ballistic missiles into the western sea as Seoul and Washington concluded a high-profile military exercise, raising tensions and drawing international condemnation.
events.description: North Korea fired four short-range ballistic missiles into the western sea as Seoul and Washington concluded a high-profile military exercise, raising tensions and drawing international condemnation.

events.name: Missile Launches
events.wd_description: North Korea launched four short-range ballistic missiles, adding to a series of missile tests this week, including a possible failed intercontinental ballistic missile.
events.description: North Korea launched four short-range ballistic missiles, adding to a series of missile tests this week, including a possible failed intercontinental ballistic missile.

events.name: Vigilant Storm Military Exercise
events.wd_description: The missile launches occurred as South Korea and the United States concluded their "Vigilant Storm" military exercise, which had been running for six days.
events.description: The missile launches occurred as South Korea and the United States concluded their "Vigilant Storm" military exercise, which had been running for six days.

events.name: International Reactions
events.wd_description: The missile tests drew condemnation from South Korea, Japan, and the United States and fueled speculation that North Korea might resume nuclear testing for the first time since 2017.
events.description: The missile tests drew condemnation from South Korea, Japan, and the United States and fueled speculation that North Korea might resume nuclear testing for the first time since 2017.

events.name: President Biden Accuses Oil Companies of War Profiteering
events.wd_label: President Biden Accuses Oil Companies of War Profiteering
events.wd_description: U.S. President Joe Biden accused oil companies of "war profiteering" and raised the possibility of a windfall tax if they do not increase domestic production to lower fuel costs.
events.description: U.S. President Joe Biden accused oil companies of "war profiteering" and raised the possibility of a windfall tax if they do not increase domestic production to lower fuel costs.

events.name: Biden's Accusation
events.wd_description: President Biden criticized oil companies for making record profits during the war while refusing to lower prices at the pump, accusing them of "war profiteering."
events.description: President Biden criticized oil companies for making record profits during the war while refusing to lower prices at the pump, accusing them of "war profiteering."

events.name: Windfall Tax Proposal
events.wd_description: Biden suggested that Congress could impose tax penalties on oil companies if they do not invest in lowering fuel costs for American citizens.
events.description: Biden suggested that Congress could impose tax penalties on oil companies if they do not invest in lowering fuel costs for American citizens.

events.name: ExxonMobil Criticism
events.wd_description: Biden specifically targeted ExxonMobil, which reported $19.7 billion in earnings in the third quarter, accusing the company of prioritizing shareholder dividends over increasing production.
events.description: Biden specifically targeted ExxonMobil, which reported $19.7 billion in earnings in the third quarter, accusing the company of prioritizing shareholder dividends over increasing production.

events.name: Dismissal of Germany's Cybersecurity Chief
events.wd_description: Germany's cybersecurity chief, Arne Schönbohm, was fired after allegations surfaced of his connections to a firm linked to Russian security circles, following a satirical TV show revelation.
events.description: Germany's cybersecurity chief, Arne Schönbohm, was fired after allegations surfaced of his connections to a firm linked to Russian security circles, following a satirical TV show revelation.

events.name: Dismissal of Schönbohm
events.wd_description: Arne Schönbohm, head of the German Federal Office for Information, was relieved of his duties as the country’s cybersecurity chief following allegations of ties to a Russian-linked firm.
events.description: Arne Schönbohm, head of the German Federal Office for Information, was relieved of his duties as the country’s cybersecurity chief following allegations of ties to a Russian-linked firm.

events.name: Allegations of Russian Connections
events.wd_description: Schönbohm's dismissal came after reports of his past connections to a Russian-linked cybersecurity firm, highlighted by a German satire show.
events.description: Schönbohm's dismissal came after reports of his past connections to a Russian-linked cybersecurity firm, highlighted by a German satire show.

events.name: Public Scrutiny
events.wd_description: The controversy surrounding Schönbohm's connections was brought to public attention by a satire show hosted by German comedian Jan Böhmermann, leading to increased scrutiny.
events.description: The controversy surrounding Schönbohm's connections was brought to public attention by a satire show hosted by German comedian Jan Böhmermann, leading to increased scrutiny.

events.name: Stellantis Secures Raw Materials for EV Batteries
events.wd_label: Stellantis Secures Raw Materials for EV Batteries
events.wd_description: Stellantis has signed a memorandum of understanding with GME Resources Limited to secure raw materials, including nickel and cobalt, needed for EV battery production, aiming to meet its decarbonization and EV production targets.
events.description: Stellantis has signed a memorandum of understanding with GME Resources Limited to secure raw materials, including nickel and cobalt, needed for EV battery production, aiming to meet its decarbonization and EV production targets.

events.name: Agreement with GME Resources
events.wd_description: Stellantis and GME Resources Limited have agreed on the future sale of battery-grade nickel and cobalt sulphate products from the NiWest Nickel-Cobalt Project in western Australia.
events.description: Stellantis and GME Resources Limited have agreed on the future sale of battery-grade nickel and cobalt sulphate products from the NiWest Nickel-Cobalt Project in western Australia.

events.name: Industry-Wide Efforts to Secure Raw Materials
events.wd_label: Industry-Wide Efforts to Secure Raw Materials
events.wd_description: Automakers, including Stellantis, GM, and Ford, are securing raw materials for EV batteries in response to government policies and growing consumer demand for electric vehicles.
events.description: Automakers, including Stellantis, GM, and Ford, are securing raw materials for EV batteries in response to government policies and growing consumer demand for electric vehicles.
